reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel EXCEEDED our expectations!The room was spacious,tastefully decorated and comfy yet contemporary.The staff was AWESOME-from housekeeping to the front desk.Parking was plenty even though the hotel was well-occupied.Breakfast in the morning was more than hearty..call it an upgraded continental with something for everyone!The swimming area seemed well-maintained(unfortunately,the jacuzzi jets were not working and the pool area closed @ 10 pm even on the weekend-the only downsides to the hotel during our visit)and there were plenty of towels and even a little sitting area outside the pool entrance.Overall,a HUGE value,considering we booked through a discount site and got ALL THE PERKS!Will definitely stay again when in the area!
reviews.title: AWESOMMMMEEEEE HOTEL!A+ for service and value
Clean, Friendly, Great Breakfast, Good Price
reviews.text: I just spent 3 wonderful nights there with my college age daughter. Our room was large and clean with lots of extra towels and a comfy bed. We both enjoyed the breakfast, which was an expanded continental (waffles, fruit, & egg dishes in addition to the typical cereal, juice, bagels & muffins). There was a small exercise room and a big indoor pool with whirlpool. The staff was friendly and helpful; the public areas were spotless; the parking lot was well-lit. There are 5 or 6 restaurants within 1/2 mile, a huge shopping center, and only 5 miles from Plymouth Harbor. We visited Boston and paid less than half the price of a room in the city. We would definetely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nice for it's class but I didn't get the best night's sleep. I was expecting the bedding to be softer. The mattress was too hard. The room next door had a clock radio playing while I was trying to sleep and I could hear the person singing along to the music. The room had "room darkening drapes" but the bright sunlight was reflecting underneath them onto the AC unit. Soooo... I couldn't fall asleep due to the noise next door, and I was woken up early due to the sunlight coming in. Plus my hips killed from sleeping on the hard mattress.
reviews.title: Didn't get the best night's sleep.

reviews.text: Other than that, for the class of the hotel, I'd rate the staff and food very good and the pool area was good.
reviews.title: Dirty, beware of floss in your bed

reviews.text: I typically love the Hampton Inn. This one is different than most. The beds and pillows are not the typical. But who cares about that the real problem is it is dirty. The first room they gave me had hair in the shower. Back again for another night later that week and the room had trash in it from the night before. When switched to a different room there was floss on my bed! Gross! Go stay somewhere else in Plymouth that cleans the rooms.
reviews.title: Great place! Only stayed one night, but...

reviews.text: Hotel was nice but very much needs a maintenance person. Many things were either broken, loose,dinged or scratched, too much to list. The lack of a good maintenance program was plainly obvious. Pool and hot tub were good but the same as mentioned, not maintained properly. Old guest item from the month before were found in the room so I gave it to the housekeeper who did not seem to know what to do with it. Breakfast was good but lacking a few essential items. TV lineup was very lame. So like I said, just good but no rave. The hotel served its purpose but nothing to right home about. The AM girl at the desk on Sunday Nov 28 was very nice and helpful, the van driver was very courteous.
reviews.title: Good but no rave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in we were told the price of the room and agreed to that price.we were given the key and sent to our room.Nothing great about it,just your average hotel room.That night I realized we were not given a receipt and decided I would wait till the morning.When we left in the morning the receipt was slipped under our door.Two day's later as I was getting ready to pay bills I noticed I was over charged from the hotel. When I called to ask what the charges were for, I was told I was pre charged for ordering movies,JUST INCASE I DID! I never heard of anything like that. They pre charge your card just incase you want a movie! Now I have to wait a week or more,due to the holiday to get my money back.I will never stay at the Hampton Inn, anywhere, ever again.
reviews.title: precharged for items at check in.

reviews.text: This is a fairly new hotel, the rooms were clean and comfortable, staff were extremely friendly and helpful, breakfast was good. Overall it was a great stay.
reviews.title: Great clean hotel, conveniently located

reviews.text: When we got to our room I looked under the beds and found lots of trash including empty juice pouches and wrappers. I complained the next morning and was assured it would be taken care of. When we returned that night the trash was still under the beds. I complained again the next day and that night it was better under one bed. I complained again the next day and that night it was better, but still was not vacuumed.
reviews.title: Very disappointed. Hotel okay, but not prepared for a lot of guests.

reviews.text: The hotel does not have enough space or food at breakfast. They have one waffle maker for everyone at the hotel so there was ten minute wait for a waffle. The hotel was out of apple and cranberry juice for an entire weekend.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn - always a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late into BOS. Rented a car and drove south to Plymouth. The manager was friendly and helped us find a restaurant within walking distance. The hotel is clean and located in a nice area. It is convenient to shopping, restaurants, highway and Plimouth Plantation.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Plymouth, MA.

reviews.text: Nice clean hotel looks to be almost brand new. The staff is very friendly and helpful. When we walked into our first room, which was clearly labeled as non-smoking, we immediately smelled smoke. I immediately called the front desk and they re-assigned us to a different room. The second room smelled plesant and was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom is large and the tub/shower are nice with plenty of hot water. Free wireless internet is available and didn't have any problems getting connected. The pool, hot tub, and fitness room all looked very nice and inviting although I didn't use them. They also have a guest laundry room which we did use on the last night so we returned home with a suitcase full of clean clothes.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean Hotel with Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint about the furnishings is that the bed is quite hard. My wife and I are used to a softer bed so we had some difficulties sleeping through the night without getting sore. However I'm sure other people prefer firm beds so they can't please everyone in that regard.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay.

reviews.text: Breakfast is good, but could be better. The hot course was different each day and usually included a type of egg (fried, scrambelled or omlet) and a type of meat (sausage, ham or bacon). While that sounds great, it was obvious that both the egg and meat choices were pre-packaged, frozen items that they just heated up. They did have fresh cooked waffels which was the best part of the breakfast. In addition to the hot items they had yogurt, fruit, cereal, toast, bagels, coffee, milk, and juice. If the hot course had been fresh, rather than frozen, I would have given the hotel five stars.
reviews.title: Nice and Clean

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a newer area of town close to Best Buy, Walmart, several chain type restaurants and other shopping. There is an wood oven pizza place next door which looked good but we didn't try it. The neighbooorhood is not really the type of area you come to Plymouth to visit, but it's OK. The Waterfront and historic distric are only about a 10 minute drive from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very satisfied!

reviews.text: Clean but did not have a refrig or microwave in room as previous reviewer mentioned. Perhaps because we had regular room instead of suite? Breakfast was as expected but with made to order waffle maker. Indoor pool was a bit cold but hot tub nice. Ample work out room. Front desk was helpful with map of the area and restaurant suggestions and business center was helpful for free printing. Located near strip mall area. TV was "old" style- not flat screen LCD we usually find these days.
reviews.title: Typical Hampton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay. No frills, but please do not read that to mean that this is a motel of any kind. They have obviously taken great pride in furnishing this hotel. The lobby area is clean, the coffee they offer all day is actually very drinkable, and the 24 hour snack shop is a great idea. The fact that every room has a microwave (which is clean) and a fridge (also spotless) just adds to the convenience. And when they say they allow dogs - they actually expect people to bring their dogs without punishing them for doing so.
reviews.title: Love it

reviews.text: I have stayed here twice and will stay again and again.
reviews.title: Great service, convenient location, and spacious/clean rooms!
Convenient, cheap and clean...
reviews.text: I traveled to Plymouth for business with other colleagues and the Hampton Inn was fantastic. The rooms were large and clean, and they have the largest bathrooms with storage space that I've seen in awhile.

reviews.title: AWESOME
reviews.text: The staff was incredibly helpful and VERY pleasant. I had to ask them to print and fax a few documents, which they did at no charge! Excellent service overall from the breakfast cook to front desk. It is also close to shopping and chain restaurants for convenience.
